**Hand Levels:**
- Full House: Level 7 (190 chips, 16 mult) - My main hand

**Analysis:**

I have 10 cards in hand (thanks to Troubadour's +2 hand size).

Looking for possible hands:
- Three Queens: Queen of Hearts (debuffed), Queen of Clubs, Queen of Diamonds - this would form three of a kind
- Actually, I need to think about Full House specifically

For a Full House, I need:
- Three of a kind + a pair


- Three Queens are available (Hearts debuffed, Clubs, Diamonds), but even though the Heart Queen won't contribute chips, it still counts toward the hand type. However, I don't see any pairs in the remaining cards, so a Full House isn't possible. Three of a Kind with the three Queens is my best option here—the base hand scores 90 chips with 9 mult at Level 4, plus the card values from the Queens themselves.

Looking at the scoring: the Clubs and Diamonds Queens each add 10 chips, while the Hearts Queen contributes nothing due to the debuff. The Blue Joker adds 86 chips, bringing the total to 196 chips. Multiplied by 9, that's 1,764 chips for this hand.

Since this is my opening play, Card Sharp won't trigger yet—it requires the same hand type twice. I could instead discard and search for better cards to build toward Full House plays, which would leverage my Level 7 Full House and the Card Sharp synergy. I'd need to find either pairs or additional three-of-a-kinds to make that work.

I have three Queens already, so landing a pair would complete a Full House immediately. I'll discard the 10 of Spades, 2 of Spades, 9 of Clubs, 5 of Clubs, and 3 of Clubs—keeping the three Queens plus the Jack and 7 of Diamonds. Drawing five fresh cards gives me a solid chance at hitting that pair.

To reach the 22,000 chip target, I need to think about scoring potential. My previous Full House hands ranged from around 3,000 to 12,700 chips, with the higher scores likely coming when Card Sharp was active for a 3x multiplier. If I can land two strong Full House hands with the second one benefiting from that multiplier, I should cross the threshold.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
